Rails 5 fix for keeping query parameters in pagination links

In Rails 5, `params` hash is no longer a simple
HashWithIndifferentAccess, but an ActionController::Parameters instance
with implements the "strong parameters" concept that prevents mass
assignment.

Rails 5.0 test compat

Drop support for old AR finder params to `paginate()`

This is not possible anymore:

    paginate(:page => 1, :order => 'foo', :conditions => {...})

It needs to be rewritten as:

    where(...).order('foo').paginate(:page => 1)

Fixes #455 [ci skip]

Operate with i18n.load_path, not i18n.railties_load_path

After Rails update [1], `railties_load_path` supports `Rails::Paths::Path` objects only.
Using `load_path` is the common approach, which is also used by other gems [2]

[1] https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/21124
[2] https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activemodel/lib/active_model.rb#L71
refactor out unless/else statement

Use alias_method instead of alias_method_chain

since alias_method_chain is now deprecated in Rails master targeting
5.0.0.

remove pending spec which purpose I forgot

deprecate renderer, previous/next_label global settings with pagination_options

Renderer shouldn't be set globally because of mounted apps
compatibility, and previous/next_label in Rails should be customized
with i18n rather than editing pagination_options.

remove :renderer from global pagination_options to discourage using it

Because lately it's popular to mount different web frameworks in the
same Ruby process (e.g. Sinatra apps beside Rails), a global link
renderer option is useless since it would affect all frameworks but it's
hardly possible that a single renderer will work in all of these
frameworks.

See resolution for #176

release 2.3.0

CHANGED LinkRenderer to receive collection, options and reference to view template NOT in constructor, but with the #prepare method.
This is a step towards supporting passing of LinkRenderer (or subclass) instances that may be preconfigured in some way.
test cases for link renderer options
allow renderer to be a LinkRenderer instance or a class and make it easier to override rendering a link.

changed page_entries_info() method to adjust its output according to humanized class name of collection items.

  page_entries_info(@posts)  #->  "Displaying all 12 posts"

Override this with :entry_name parameter.
fix ActionView inline template for edge Rails
Added option to specify entry name in page_entries_info
goodbye, '.gemified'. we'll miss you
add gemspec file. change rake manifest to auto-update the gemspec. get rid of rubyforge release task
extract reusable pagination testing stuff into WillPaginate::ViewTestCase
bump the tiny version number (at v2.2.3 now)
rethink the page URL construction mechanizm to be more bulletproof because people want to use custom route params for page
test that anchor parameter can be used in pagination links
Add support for page parameter in custom routes like "/foo/page/2"
bump up tiny version number to 2.2.2
Change output of "page_entries_info" on single-page collection and erraneous output with empty collection as reported by Tim Chater.
bump to 2.2.1 and release
take less risky path when monkeypatching named_scope; fix that it no longer requires ActiveRecord::VERSION
use strings in "respond_to?" calls to work around a bug in acts_as_ferret stable (ugh)

rename LinkRenderer#url_params to #url_for and drastically optimize it

deprecation notices if you use a collection that responds to old `page_count` in view helpers
move Array#paginate definition to will_paginate/array.rb
Remove old, deprecated style of calling Array#paginate as "paginate(page, per_page)". If you want to specify :page, :per_page or :total_entries, use a parameter hash.
Rename WillPaginate::Collection#page_count to #total_pages for consistency. If you implemented this interface, change your implementation accordingly.
Change gap in pagination links from '...' to '…'. That way it can be better styled or manipulated via the DOM.
add Lourens Naud to contributors
rename with_pagination to paginated_section and add better docs and tests

don't use `returning`. now Collection is independent from ActiveSupport
don't require 'will_paginate' in will_paginate/collection.rb, which enables loading of WillPaginate::Collection in 3rd-party code without having to load all of WillPaginate
